result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alan W. Schrank Jr.

records.addlTxt: Cases 21CF220, 22CF52, 22CF55, 22CF84 called @ 9:38 AM: Defendant Alan W. Schrank Jr. in court, in custody. Attorney Paul Edward Zilles in court for Alan W. Schrank Jr. Attorney Matthew Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained. Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea: 21CF220 - Counts 1 & 4 - NC. 22CF52 - Counts 1, 3, & 6 - NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. 21CF220 - Counts 2, 3, 5, 6, & 7 - DRI. 22CF52 - Counts 2, 4, & 5 - DRI. 22CF55 - DRI. 22CF84 - DRI. Statement by DA Leusink. Statement by Atty Zilles. No statement by the DE. Statement by the Court. Court orders: 21CF220 - Count 1 - 42 month term of imprisonment - bifurcated sentence - 18 months IC/24 months ES, concurrent to 21CF220 - Count 4. 21CF220 - Count 4 - 7 year term of imprisonment - bifurcated sentence - 30 months IC/54 months ES, consecutive to 22CF52. 22CF52 - Counts 1 & 3 - 42 month term of imprisonment - 18 months IC/30 months ES, concurrent to 22CF52 - Count 6. 22CF52 - Count 6 - 7 year term of imprisonment - bifurcated sentence - 30 months IC/54 months ES. Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program or the Challenge Incarceration Program. 22CF52 - 236 days CFTS. 21CF220 - 1 day CFTS. ES Conditions: AODA and follow through. The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Psychological Evaluation and follow through. Any other counseling or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent. No contact with C.M. or J.M. directly or indirectly. No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communications or by third party. Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Restitution in the amount of $210.27 requested in 22CF55 to be paid in full within 60 days of release to extended supervision. Bond previously posted in the amount of $1000 in case 21CF220 to be applied. Appeal rights given.
AMENDED
Restitution Summary - $210.27
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

21CF220, 22CF52 & 22CF55 Cases called @ 1:23 PM Defendant Alan W. Schrank Jr. in court, in custody, appears with Attorney Paul Edward Zilles. Attorney Wesley J Kottke for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. 22CF52 - Officer Conner Wilson sworn in for testimony. Direct exam by ADA Kottke. Witness identifies the defendant. Exhibits 1 & 2 marked. Witness testifies to exhibits 1 & 2. Cross exam by Atty Zilles. The Court questions the witness. Witness excused at 1:46 p.m. Atty Kottke offers exhibits 1 & 2. No objection by Atty Zilles. The Court receives exhibits 1 & 2. The Court finds probable cause. Defendant BOT. Information filed by Atty Kottke. Receipt admitted - reading waived. NG plea entered. STC scheduled - NOH given. Status conference scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 11:30 am.
